title: Move Right
hint: Use l to move right, then r to replace a character
solutionExplanation: rX — 'replace': replaces the character under the cursor with X. No motion needed since the cursor starts at column 0.

title: Down and Replace
hint: Use j to move down, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: j — moves cursor down one line. rX — replaces the character under the cursor with X.

title: Navigate Grid
hint: Move down with j, right with l, then replace with r
solutionExplanation: j — moves down one line. ll — moves right two columns. rX — replaces the character under the cursor with X.

title: Jump Words
hint: Use w to jump forward by word, then ~ to toggle case
solutionExplanation: ww — jumps forward two words, landing on 'foo'. ~ — toggles the case of the character under the cursor (f→F).

title: Word Delete
hint: Use dw to delete a word
solutionExplanation: dw — 'delete word': deletes from cursor to the start of the next word, removing 'delete '.

title: Back a Word
hint: Use dw to delete the word under cursor
solutionExplanation: dw — deletes the word under the cursor ('remove '), since the cursor starts at column 5 on 'remove'.

title: Go to End
hint: Use A to append at end of line
solutionExplanation: A — appends at end of line (moves to end and enters Insert mode). ; — types the semicolon. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Start of Line
hint: Use ^ to go to first non-blank, then ~ to toggle case
solutionExplanation: ^ — moves to the first non-blank character ('h'). ~ — toggles its case to uppercase.

title: Delete to End
hint: Use D to delete from cursor to end of line
solutionExplanation: D — deletes from the cursor position to the end of the line. Equivalent to d$.

title: Jump to Last Line
hint: Use G to jump to last line, then $ and r or cw
solutionExplanation: G — jumps to the last line. $ — moves to the last character ('e'). r — replaces it with 'd'.

title: First Line Edit
hint: Use gg to go to first line, then gUiw or VU
solutionExplanation: gg — jumps to the first line. V — enters Visual Line mode to select the entire line. U — uppercases the selection.

title: Find and Replace Char
hint: Use fx to jump to 'x', then ~ to toggle case
solutionExplanation: fx — jumps forward to the first 'x' on the line. ~ — toggles its case to uppercase.

title: Delete Until
hint: Use dt to delete up to a character
solutionExplanation: dtk — 'delete till k': deletes from cursor up to (but not including) the character 'k', removing 'remove---'.

title: Change to Char
hint: Use ct_ to change up to underscore
solutionExplanation: ct — 'change till': ct_ would change up to '_', but here ct with no underscore changes to the next 't'. Types 'new' as replacement. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Move Left
hint: Use h to move left, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: h — moves cursor left one column. rX — replaces the character under the cursor with X.

title: Up One
hint: Move up with k, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: k — moves cursor up one line. rX — replaces the character under the cursor with X.

title: Back a Word
hint: Use b to jump back a word, then ~ to toggle case
solutionExplanation: b — jumps backward one word, landing on 'two'. ~ — toggles the case of the character under the cursor (t→T).

title: End Toggle
hint: Use e to jump to end of word, then ~
solutionExplanation: e — moves to the end of the current word ('go' → lands on 'o'). ~ — toggles its case (o→O).

title: Start Replace
hint: Use 0 to go to start, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: 0 — moves to column 0 (start of line). ra — replaces the character under the cursor with 'a'.

title: Fix Last
hint: Use $ to go to end, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: $ — moves to the last character on the line ('?'). r! — replaces it with '!'.

title: Last Line Fix
hint: Use G to jump to last line, then $r to replace
solutionExplanation: G — jumps to the last line. $ — moves to the last character ('.'). r! — replaces it with '!'.

title: Add Comment
hint: Use gg to go to first line, then I to insert at start
solutionExplanation: gg — jumps to the first line. I — enters Insert mode at the beginning of the line. Types '// ' and <Esc> returns to Normal mode.

title: Next Paragraph
hint: Use } to jump to next paragraph, then A to append
solutionExplanation: } — jumps to the next blank line (end of paragraph), then to the next paragraph start. A — appends at end of line. ! — types the exclamation mark. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Swap Underscore
hint: Use f_ to find underscore, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: f_ — jumps forward to the first underscore. r- — replaces it with a dash.

title: Backward Find
hint: Use F? to jump back, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: F? — jumps backward to the '?' character. r! — replaces it with '!'.

hint: Use a count before j to jump multiple lines at once, e.g. 5j
solutionExplanation: 5j — moves down 5 lines using a count prefix. rX — replaces the character under the cursor with X.

title: Count Words
hint: Use a count before w to jump multiple words, e.g. 4w
solutionExplanation: 4w — jumps forward 4 words using a count prefix, landing on 'five'. ~ — toggles the case (f→F).

title: WORD Jump
hint: Use W (uppercase) to jump by WORD — it skips over punctuation
solutionExplanation: W — jumps forward by WORD (skips over punctuation like '-'). ~ — toggles the case (n→N).

title: Jump to Match
hint: Use % to jump to the matching bracket, then r to replace it
solutionExplanation: % — jumps to the matching bracket ')'. r] — replaces it with ']'.
